Notes.Text:
libgcrypt was updated to include countermeasures against Lenstra's fault attack on RSA Chinese Remainder Theorem optimization in RSA.

A signature verification step was updated to protect against leaks of private keys in case of hardware faults or implementation errors in numeric libraries.

GnuPG already performed this check by itself and was not affected. This fix is equivalent, but not equal to CVE-2015-5738
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: The RSA-CRT implementation in the Cavium Software Development Kit (SDK) 2.x, when used on OCTEON II CN6xxx Hardware on Linux to support TLS with Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS), makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain private RSA keys by conducting a Lenstra side-channel attack.
